titleStmt.title: N. Long et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8662

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives

body.p:
Georgetown Feby. 12th 1863
His Excelency Jas F. Robinson
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your Petioners Petit Jurors who heard the case in the Scott Circuit Court of the Commonwealth against Philips for Stealing Benj Osbornes horse nearly Four years ago would respectfully petition your Excelency to take into consideration his laborious services performed with industry and advantage to the commonwelth
We ask of you that you pardon Philips and restore him to Society

N Long
N,, Long
Hilery Roberts
John Herriott
George Allgairs
W. S. Nollcroft
Alex Carrick
Moses Rish
E, B, Duvall
Stephen T, Twyman

Scott Cir. Ct
Victor Phillips pettn for Pardon
5 yrs Penty

I am satisfied that all the ends of Justice have been fulfilled so far as punishment is concerned in this case. There are strong grounds to hope & believe that the subject is a reformed man He is hereby Pardoned 4 June 1863

To his Excellency Jas F. Robinson
Govenor of Commonwealth of Ky
